    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder(@NonNull
               Site site,
               @NonNull
               java.lang.String payerEmail,
               @NonNull
               java.util.List<Item> items)
        Builder for custom CheckoutPreference construction. It should be only used if you are processing the payment with a Payment processor. Otherwise you should use the ID constructor.
        Parameters:
        site - preference site Sites.getById(String)
        payerEmail - payer email
        items - items to pay

      • setBinaryMode

        public CheckoutPreference.Builder setBinaryMode(boolean isBinaryMode)
        If enableBinaryMode is called, processed payment can only be APPROVED or REJECTED. Default value is false.

        Non compatible with PaymentProcessor.

        Non compatible with off payments methods

        Returns:
        builder to keep operating

      • setDefaultInstallments

        public CheckoutPreference.Builder setDefaultInstallments(@Nullable
                                                         java.lang.Integer defaultInstallments)
        When default installments is not null then this value will be forced as installment selected if it matches with one provided by the Installments service.
        Parameters:
        defaultInstallments - number of the value to be forced
        Returns:
        builder

      • setExpirationDate

        public CheckoutPreference.Builder setExpirationDate(@Nullable
                                                    java.util.Date date)
        Date that indicates when this preference expires. If the preference is expired, then the checkout will show an error.
        Parameters:
        date - creation date.
        Returns:
        builder

      • setActiveFrom

        public CheckoutPreference.Builder setActiveFrom(@Nullable
                                                java.util.Date date)
        Date that indicates from when the preference is active. If the preference is related with a date in the future then an error screen will be shown.
        Parameters:
        date - creation date.
        Returns:
        builder
